尽管其他组织不同意，但联合国的人口预测表明，到 2060 年，人口将超过 100 亿。

文章《全球人口何时达到顶峰？》首先出现在视觉资本家。

;

将全球人口预测与 2100 年进行比较

世界人口何时达到顶峰？

根据联合国2022年世界人口展望修订版的数据，我们可能会在2080年代末的某个时候看到超过104亿人口的峰值。

虽然联合国的预测使用最广泛，但这并不一定意味着它们是最准确的。一些替代模型预测峰值会更早且更低，这表明世界人口下降的速度可能比预期更快。

在联合国的最新修订中，它将自己对2100年全球人口的估计从109亿（截至2019年）下调至104亿（截至2022年）。

在这张图中，我们直观地展示了三个组织对 2100 年人口的预测：联合国、健康指标与评估研究所 (IHME) 和国际应用系统分析研究所 (IIASA)。

数据和亮点

下表列出了我们用于创建此图形的人口预测数据。请注意，联合国的预测截至 2022 年，IHME 的预测截至 2020 年，IIASA 的预测截至 2014 年。

年联合国IHME国际航空航天局
2050年9,687,440,000 9,551,506,077 9,140,​​396,000
2060 10,053,522,000 9,719,318,272 9,340,845,000
2070 10,288,412,000 9,700,610,324 9,397,164,000
2080 10,411,747,000 9,515,888,869 9,334,601,000
2090 10,425,269,000 9,200,632,391 9,173,133,000
2100 10,355,002,000 8,785,553,665 8,948,235,000

从这个数据我们可以看出，联合国预计世界人口将在2086年达到峰值，并在2100年保持在100亿以上。

另一方面， IHME和IIASA模型均未预计全球人口将达到 100 亿，而是预测在 2060 年代达到97 亿的峰值 (IHME) 或在 2070 年达到 94 亿(IIASA)。这两个模型还预测到 2100 年人口将回落至 80 亿。

到 2100 年，这一差距是巨大的，例如，IHME 的预测比联合国的预测低16 亿。

什么是 IHME 和 IIASA？它们为何不同？

健康指标与评估研究所 (IHME) 是一家位于西雅图的研究机构，由比尔及梅琳达·盖茨基金会于 2007 年成立。其使命是“向世界提供及时、相关且科学有效的证据，以改善卫生政策和实践。”

另一方面，国际应用系统分析研究所 (IIASA) 是一家总部位于奥地利的国际研究机构，成立于 1972 年。它的成立是为了改善苏联和美国之间的科学合作，目前成员包括20多个国家。

为了理解为什么 IHME 和 IIASA 模型与联合国的模型不同，让我们看看每个组织对生育率的预测，生育率以每个妇女的孩子数量来衡量。

根据该图表，IHME 和 IIASA 预计全球生育率将在 2050 年之前以更快的速度下降，然后在接近 2100 年时趋于稳定。这与联合国的预测形成鲜明对比，联合国的预测预计生育率将在所有时期以更慢、更稳定的速度下降。到2100的路。

一般来说，一个国家越发达，其出生率就会下降。这是由于许多因素造成的，例如女性受教育率较高（因此更多女性进入劳动力市场）、获得避孕药具和计划生育的机会更多，以及生育成本更高。

非洲生育率下降的速度有多快？

撒哈拉以南非洲地区是世界上生育率最高的地区之一，但随着该地区经济的快速增长，生育率正在迅速下降。 。例如，撒哈拉以南非洲地区的人均 GDP 已从 2000 年的632 美元攀升至 2022 年的1,690 美元。

由于这种经济转型，一些研究人员认为，非洲将经历类似于东亚的快速人口转型，人口增长急剧下降。例如，联合国儿童基金会 2021 年的一项调查发现，尼日利亚的生育率在短短五年内从5.8下降到4.6 （下降 17%）。

请考虑威尔逊中心2023 年 7 月发表的这篇文章，了解有关尼日利亚人口统计演变的更多背景信息。

现在回到当前的问题，让我们看看联合国和 IHME 对撒哈拉以南非洲地区生育率的预测有何不同。

这些差异可能看起来很小，但即使是小数点后几位也会产生巨大的影响。例如，让我们回顾一下联合国对 2100 年的人口预测，即104 亿人。

根据联合国的低生育率设想（出生率仍低 0.5），2100 年人口将大大减少70 亿。与此同时，在高生育率情景下（出生率仍高出0.5），人口将激增至147亿。

因此，撒哈拉以南非洲等高生育率地区的出生率变化将对全球人口何时达到顶峰产生重大影响。

2030 年可再生能源目标的进展

这最初发布在脱碳频道上。订阅免费邮件列表，成为第一个看到与脱碳相关的图形（重点关注美国能源行业）的人。

国际能源署指出，到 2030 年，全球可再生能源装机容量必须增加两倍，才能将全球变暖限制在比工业化前水平高 1.5°C 的范围内。

这使得未来六年对于气候斗争至关重要，即将在迪拜举行的联合国 COP28 活动是评估各国实现 2030 年目标进展情况的绝佳时机。

检查进度

正如《巴黎协定》中的国家自主贡献所述，包括美国、欧盟、中国、印度和英国等主要电力消费国在内的许多国家都制定了雄心勃勃的目标，通过2030年。

然而，数据表明，许多企业正在努力跟上所需的年度产能增量，以实现这些目标。

目前，中国是唯一有望实现 2030 年目标的国家。 2022 年，它不仅满足而且大大超过了保持正轨所需的新增容量，增加了所需 101 吉瓦的168% 。

现在让我们仔细看看这些国家的情况，比较他们需要增加的风能和太阳能发电量与 2022 年实际增加的量。

奋起直追：迈向 2030 年之路

美国、欧盟、中国、印度和英国的电力消耗合计占全球电力消耗的 60% 以上，凸显了它们在电力行业脱碳方面的重大责任。

在实现 2030 年目标方面，研发投资、政策支持和基础设施发展都是关键部分。

未来几年，这些国家将有机会改变全球能源格局，并推动在全球范围内实现净零排放。

上海合作组织扩大

中国积极推动上海合作组织这一欧亚政治、经济和国际安全实体的扩大。

该组织由俄罗斯、中国和前苏联国家于 2001 年成立，旨在制衡西方在该地区的影响力。

上面的地图使用了来自Incrementum 、 联合国和上合组织的数据来说明全球最大区域组织的发展。

上合组织时间表

上合组织的成立宗旨是打击恐怖主义、促进边境安全、加强政治联系、扩大经济合作，最初成员包括中国、哈萨克斯坦、俄罗斯、塔吉克斯坦、乌兹别克斯坦和吉尔吉斯斯坦。

2002年，成员国批准了该组织章程，以鼓励政治、贸易、经济、技术、文化和教育合作。

此后，该组织已承担了20多个与交通、能源和电信相关的大型项目。一项值得注意的举措是中国广泛的“ 一带一路”倡议，旨在通过重大基础设施投资重建丝绸之路，将中国与亚洲、欧洲及其他地区连接起来。

该组织还扩大了其地缘政治影响力。它于2005年获得联合国大会观察员地位，并于2012年给予阿富汗观察员地位。目前，它正在与塔利班临时政府合作，让阿富汗代表参加未来的会议。

印度和巴基斯坦于2017年正式成为上合组织成员国，伊朗正在申请成为正式成员国。埃及和卡塔尔是对话伙伴，美国传统盟友沙特阿拉伯也已采取措施加入。白俄罗斯在签署义务备忘录后将于 2024 年成为成员国。

此外，该组织还在中国的军事野心中发挥着至关重要的作用。

2007年，上海合作组织签署了一项协议，概述了在另一个成员国举行军事演习的合法权利和责任。

该协议允许中国军队在海外开展空地作战行动，涵盖远程动员、反恐任务、维稳行动和常规战争等活动。

军事存在对于中国共产党来说尤为重要，因为它担心维吾尔族主导的新疆自治区的分裂主义运动可能会获得其他中亚国家的支持。

对美国的影响

如今，上合组织涵盖了全球42%的人口和全球32%的GDP。

由于上海合作组织影响力不断增强，美国决策者一直关注其发展。

美中经济与安全审查委员会在 2020 年向美国国会提交的报告中强调，通过上海合作组织，中国正在建立外交关系和远征能力，以支持向境外投射力量。

该文件称，“北京可能会利用其与上合组织国家的关系来限制美国武装部队在中亚开展行动的能力，这是一个重大风险。”

尽管如此，同一份报告还提到，上海合作组织可以成为中亚国家的有益工具，提供合作平台，并为俄罗斯潜在的主导地位提供替代方案，特别是在能源等领域。

控制你能控制的

为了帮助避免这些常见的投资错误，投资者可以记住保持理性并专注于他们的长期目标。建立可靠的投资组合通常涉及评估以下因素：

  • 财务目标
  • 当前收入
  • 消费习惯
  • 市场环境
  • 预期回报

考虑到这些因素，投资者可以避免关注短期市场波动，并进行力所能及的控制。从长远来看，进行小额投资可以产生强大的影响，只需长期持续投资，就有可能积累大量财富。

在过去十年的大部分时间里，散户投资者被视为股市的副业，但现在却成为值得考虑的投资巨头。

但他们是怎么到达那里的呢？

我们查看了Vanda Research的数据，该数据跟踪 2014 年至 2023 年间美国散户投资者的每日净流量（使用 21 天移动平均线计算），如上图所示。

然而，一系列因素推动散户投资者在2019年底再创新高。

免费投资平台，加上大流行导致的封锁带来的无聊，再加上联邦援助支票，促使投资者纷纷涌入市场。到 2020 年第一季度，每日净流量达到12.8 亿美元，几乎是 2015 年高点的两倍。

人们为什么移民到美国？

美国是一个由世界各地的移民创建和建设的国家。因此，它的移民数量比任何其他国家都多。

截至2021年，超过4530万居住在美国的人是在外国出生的，约占世界移民的五分之一。但有些人是来与家人团聚的，而另一些人则是为了寻找工作或逃离危险的境地。

那么人们为什么移民到美国呢？该视觉效果使用USAFacts编制的美国国务院数据来展示 2021 年新移民美国的不同原因。

2021 年移民为何来到美国

特定年份的新移民数据包括非旅游签证、新移民绿卡、难民和庇护者。

每个抵达者都属于一个广泛的入场类别：

  • 工作：包括特殊职业或临时农业工作的签证，以及为就业颁发的新移民绿卡。
  • 学校：包括学生签证和学生签证获得者的家庭。
  • 家庭：包括为美国公民亲属签发的移民签证和新移民绿卡。
  • 安全：包括难民和庇护者，以及因担心安全或迫害而签发的移民签证和新移民绿卡。
  • Diversity: Entry through the Diversity Visa Program—also known as the “green card lottery”—which accepts applicants from countries with low numbers of immigrants in the previous five years.

New arrivals for work were the largest cohort of entries to America, totaling 638,551 people or 41.8% of new arrivals. The majority came from neighboring Mexico, which accounted for 55% of incoming workers and was the largest single country of origin.

School and education saw 492,153 people 32.2% of new US arrivals, with the majority coming from Asian countries. China had the most school-related entries into the US out of individual countries, accounting for 19.0% of total school-related entries, followed by India at 17.4%.

Family entries to the US comprised just 23.2% or under a quarter of incoming new arrivals. In these instances, the largest cohorts came from India (17.6% of family entrants) and Mexico (15.2% of family entrants).

Growth of US Immigration

Though 2021 saw less entrants than before 2020 as a prolonged result of the COVID-19 pandemic, it still tracks with increased immigration to the US in the long term.

In 1965, the US updated its immigration laws , removing a national origins quota system with regional caps and preferences “emphasizing family reunification and skilled immigrants.”

Since then, the number of immigrants living in the US has more than quadrupled. As of 2022, immigrants accounted for 13.9% of the US population, or nearly 1 in 7 people.

US Immigration from Global Perspective

The US population contains a high level of immigrants, though immigration is an even more pronounced factor in some other countries in the world. For example, Canada's foreign-born population accounted for 23% of the country's total population in 2021.

Some countries actually have immigrants constitute the majority of their populations . In the Persian Gulf, the United Arab Emirates saw 88% of its population in 2020 come from foreign countries, while Qatar saw 75%.

Immigration levels have waxed and waned over time, but remains a vital part of the American story today.

Why Are the Number of North Korean Defectors Decreasing?

North Korea, formally known as the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, is a totalitarian dictatorship with extremely limited freedoms and rights reported for its citizens.

Due to the country's tight controls on borders and information, people that want to leave the country often have to physically escape and are known as defectors.

These visuals use data from the South Korea's Ministry of Reunification to track the number of North Korean defectors who make it to South Korea each year, as well as international reporting to explain the dwindling numbers.

From the 1990s to 2010, we can see the amount of North Korean defectors steadily climbing to a peak of 2,914 people in 2009 alone.

More residents looked to escape the country after suffering through the North Korean Famine of 1994 to 1998—with death estimates ranging from 240,000 to 3,500,000—as well as the country's increasingly bleak economic conditions following the collapse of the neighboring Soviet Union.

We can also see the immediate impact of Kim Jung Un's rise to power since 2012, with successful defections immediately dropping by 1,204 year-over-year and declining consistently over the next decade. Stronger border controls were one factor, as were improved relations with China and agreements with Russia on sending escapees back to North Korea.

And North Korea has seen defections drop further, from thousands to low hundreds, since 2020. Following the COVID-19 pandemic, the country shut down all borders , created new barriers, and significantly limited internal travel.

Mapping Escape Routes from North Korea


Click here to see a larger version of the graphic above.

Since they can't cross the heavily surveilled and militarized border to South Korea, the Korean Demilitarized Zone, North Korean defectors have to travel through Russia or China to get to friendly countries in order to seek asylum.

For most defectors, these include reaching Mongolia to the north or Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, and Vietnam to the south, which all work with the South Korean government on reunification.

There are also defectors that try to stay in Russia or China. In 2009, a global refugee survey found there were 11,000 North Korean refugees hiding in China close to the North Korea border alone, not accounting for the rest of the country.

Others are able to seek refuge in other countries and eventually attain citizenship. In 2022, the UNHCR registered 260 refugees and 127 asylees from North Korea, with Germany hosting the most at 96 and the US second at 70.

The Tourist Beaches Predicted to Shrink the Most

Sandy beaches comprise more than one-third of the world's coastline —but nearly half of this could be gone by 2100.

This graphic by HawaiianIslands.com uses European Commission data that estimates how shorelines worldwide will change over the next decades.

How this Graphic Works

The source conducted an analysis using European Commission data, estimating global shoreline changes by 2100.

Utilizing this data, they calculated the average decrease or increase (in meters) for the shorelines of the 10 most-reviewed beaches in each country on TripAdvisor.

Subsequently, they identified the top 20 tourist beaches projected to experience the most significant reduction in size. The beach boundaries were delineated using the Google Maps API.

Beaches Shrinking by 2100

According to various research, climate change is the main cause of sea levels rising across the globe. In the 20th century alone, it's estimated that the mean global sea level rose by 11-16 cm.

Typically, beaches might naturally shift inland in response to higher water levels. However, over the last few decades, beaches, caught between rising seas and structures such as buildings and roads, have found themselves with nowhere to go.

Landmark Beach in Lagos, Nigeria, is expected to be the worst hit by 2100, losing 918.3 m of shoreline due to rising sea levels.

Lagos is already suffering the severe impact of rising seas through increased flooding, water-borne disease, and declining water quality.

What's Causing Sea Levels to Rise?

Since the 1970s, the world has experienced an average temperature increase of 0.15 to 0.20°C per decade, as indicated by NASA research.

This global warming phenomenon has triggered the melting of polar ice caps, resulting in the loss of approximately 28 trillion tonnes of ice within a little over two decades.

Concurrently, global sea levels have escalated by an average of 34.6 mm during the same period.

In the face of the challenge, solutions such as creating dunes along the backshore of beaches, increasing shoreline setbacks, and planting submerged aquatic vegetation to reduce erosion have been studied to mitigate the impact of rising sea levels.

Mapped: The Top Middle East Exports by Country

The Middle East is widely recognized for its significant role in the global energy market. However, countries in the region also foster other substantial industries, including metals, chemicals, and agriculture.

The graphic above uses 2021 exports data from The Observatory of Economic Complexity to help explain the economy of the Middle East.

Though Afghanistan is not part of the traditionally defined Middle East, we've included it due to multiple organizations counting it as part of the region.

Top Exports by Middle-Eastern Countries in 2021

In 2021, the Middle East's exports reached a total value of $1.27 trillion. While the region lags behind Asia, Europe, and North America in global exports , it outpaces Africa and South America.

Despite many countries undertaking efforts to diversify their economies and reduce their oil dependence, most of the exports still come from fossil fuels.

The Middle East accounts for one-third of global oil production , producing over 30 million barrels per day. Five of the world's top 10 oil producers are located in the region.

But some countries like Türkiye show off more diverse economies. The country's exports range from minerals to machinery and textiles, with cars as its top export. The country is actually one of the world's top automotive exporters .

Israel is another of the Middle East's most diverse economies. The country's major exports encompass electronics, software, and refined petroleum, but cut diamonds rank as the country's largest single export by value.

Iran has tapped into its ample reserves of oil and natural gas in a different way, becoming a significant producer of plastics. Presently, plastics and rubbers constitute one-quarter of Iran's exports.

How the Middle East Impacts the Global Economy

Given that the oil sector is one of the most significant in the global economy in terms of both volume and transaction value, many Middle Eastern countries are substantial players in international politics .

Nations such as Saudi Arabia and the UAE have direct impact on the oil market and play a pivotal role in determining the price of the commodity.

Due to the region's massive exports (and imports of goods), and the importance of oil and gas in goods manufacturing worldwide, regional conflicts by Middle Eastern countries also impact global markets directly.
